info.description:
## Protocol:

### Status codes

Some responses are expectable for all kind of requests and must be managed while
not specified in the responses:

| Code | Description                                                      |
|:----:|------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 422  | `Unprocessable Entity`                                           |
|      | The server cannot or will not process the request due to         |
|      | something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed|
|      | request syntax or invalid request message). The response must be |
|      | an _Rfc 7807_ problem description.                               |
| 401  | `Unauthorized`                                                   |
|      | The authorization token is absent, invalid, has expired or has   |
|      | been revoked. The response must be an _Rfc 7807_ problem         |
|      | description.                                                     |

### Parameters

#### Email addresses
When present in the URL as path or query parameter, an email address must 
be [URL encoded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding).

#### Phone numbers

Phone numbers are **always** formatted as the [_E.164_ convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164). 

When present in the URL as path or query parameter, a phone number must be 
[URL encoded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding).
info.title: Masana RESTful API

post.description: Attempt to authenticate an user using his email address and password.
Logs out the current user by cleaning the necessary authentication cookies.

Register a beneficiary. Once registered, any user with the beneficiary email
and password will be able to authenticate.

201.description: The beneficiary is registered and active.

Location.description: Relative URL to access this beneficiary

Set-Cookies.description:
Set authentication cookies to authenticate as this beneficiary.
Thoses cookies must be reused in all subsequent requests for
the same session.

422.description:
The beneficiary registration process failed. No further details are
given for security reasons.

get.description:
Return a collection of measures owned by one beneficiary.
**Note:** One of the `startDateTime` or `startId` is required. They are mutually exclusive.

parameters.description:
This parameter is **required** when `startId` is not used.
A date to get measures around and at this date time. The direction is given via the `take` parameter.
parameters.name: startDateTime

parameters.description:
This parameter is **required** when `startDateTime` is not used.
A measure id to get measures around it (excluded). The direction is given via the `take` parameter.
parameters.name: startId

parameters.description:
The maximum number of measures to return.
  + a **negative** value will return measures taken **before** the
    "start" parameter.
  + a **positive** value will return measures taken **after** the
    "start" parameter.
parameters.name: take

400.description: One of the required parameters is missing

404.description: Either the beneficiary ref or the startId ref is unknown

post.description: Create and save a new measure for the beneficiary identified by the ref.

201.description: The new measure has been recorded.

post.summary: Create a measure for the beneficiary.

post.description:
Create a validation code for this email address. The validation code
will be sent by mail to this address as soon as possible; receiving a
response does not means that the email as been sent.

parameters.description:
Name and version of the client application. Unauthorized applications
will be discarded silently.
parameters.name: user-agent

202.description: The code is generated and will be sent as soon as possible

head.description:
Validate that the given `code` is associated with this email address
and has not expired.

parameters.description: The validation code as sent to the user.
parameters.name: code

200.description: The code exists and is valid.

422.description: The code is invalid. No further details are given for security reasons.

get.description: Returns the professional invitations for all organisations. Only the invitations with status `PENDING`, `LINKED` or `EXPIRED` are returned.
Returns the professional invitations for this organisation. Only the invitations with status `PENDING`, `LINKED` or `EXPIRED` are returned.
get.summary: Retrieve all professional invitations for one organisation

post.description:
An invitation is created and sent to the guest so that it will be able
to join the organisation.

202.description: The invitation is created and will be sent a soon as possible

404.description: There is no organisation matching the 'organisationRef'.

422.description:
Some required conditions are not met. Read the InvitationRequest
to get some hints.

post.summary: Invite an professional in this organisation

delete.description: Cancel an invitation so that it cannot be used. The linking code will be invalidated.

404.description: No invitation found for the given reference

409.description: The invitation status prevented his cancellation

post.description: Generate a new linking code and resend the invitation. The previous code is automatically invalidated. The renewed invitation will be sent trough the same channels and recipient.

202.description: The invitation is renewed and will be sent a soon as possible

404.description: There is no invitation matching the 'invitationRef'.

409.description: The status does not allow this invitation to be renewed.

429.description: There was too many renew for a given amount of time.

post.summary: Renew the code and resend the invitation

post.description:
Create a validation code for this mobile phone number. The validation
code will be sent by SMS to this mobile phone number as soon as
possible; receiving a response does not means that the SMS has been
sent.

parameters.description: Mobile phone number at format E.164. **Must** be url encoded
parameters.name: number

parameters.description:
Name and version of the client application. Unauthorized applications
will be discarded silently.
parameters.name: user-agent

202.description: The code is generated and will be sent as soon as possible

post.summary: Create a mobile phone number validation code

head.description:
Validate that the given `code` is associated with this mobile phone
number and has not expired.

parameters.description: Mobile phone number at format E.164. **Must** be url encoded
parameters.name: number

parameters.description: The validation code as sent to the user.
parameters.name: code

200.description: The code exists and is valid.

422.description: The code is invalid. No further details are given for security reasons.

head.summary: Validate a mobile phone number validation code

get.description: Return an unordered collection of all active professions in the system.

post.description: Create a profession that can be used by all organisations.

201.description: The profession is created and ready to be used.

Location.description: Relative URL to access this profession

post.description:
Register a professional. Once registered, any user with the professional
email and password will be able to authenticate.

201.description: The professional is registered and active.

Location.description: Relative URL to access this professional

Set-Cookies.description:
Set authentication cookies to authenticate as this professional.
Thoses cookies must be reused in all subsequent requests for the
same session.

422.description:
The professional registration process failed. No further details are
given for security reasons.

post.description:
Register a sys admin. Once registered, any user with the sys admin email
and password will be able to authenticate.

201.description: The sys admin is registered and active.

Location.description: Relative URL to access this sys admin

Set-Cookies.description:
Set authentication cookies to authenticate as this sys admin.
Thoses cookies must be reused in all subsequent requests for
the same session.

422.description:
The sys admin registration process failed. No further details are
given for security reasons.

get.description: Get a collection of all organisations

201.description: The organisation has been successfully created.

Location.description: Relative URL to access this organisation

404.description: There is no organisation matching the 'organisationRef'.

200.description: The organisation has been successfully updated.

get.description: Get an organisation's privacy policy document.

200.description: The organisation's privacy policy document content.

404.description: The organisation's privacy policy document is not defined yet.

get.summary: Get an organisation's privacy policy document

201.description: The organisation's privacy policy has been successfully uploaded.

422.description: The organisation's privacy policy upload process failed.

get.description: List all calendar events for a beneficiary.

200.description: The list of calendar events for the beneficiary.

get.summary: List all calendar events for a beneficiary.

post.description: Create a new calendar event for the given beneficiary.

201.description: The calendar event has been successfully created.

Location.description: Relative URL to access this calendar event

422.description: The calendar event creation process failed.

post.summary: Create a new calendar event for the given beneficiary.

404.description: There is no calendar event matching the 'calendarEventRef'.

200.description: The calendar event has been successfully updated.

get.description:
Return the asset at `path`. The returned asset content may be compressed
with "gzip" when the corresponding `Accept-Encoding` header is present.
Entity tags are provided to cache the asset.

See:
  + [Content codings and gzip at Rfc7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-3.1.2.2)
  + [Entity Tags at Rfc7232](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3)

parameters.description:
Accept-Encoding header to negotiate the content. Only "gzip"
is supported.
parameters.name: Accept-Encoding

parameters.description: If-None-Match header to prevent downloading unmodified content.
parameters.name: If-None-Match

200.description:
The asset binary content. The `Content-Type` header should
describe the asset type.

304.description: If the `If-None-Match` header was used and match the asset Etag.

MeasureOfLungCapacityResponse.description:
A measure of lunge capacity as replied by our API. The `fev1FvcRatio`
is computed and returned by our system.

identityRef.description: the reference of the authenticated identity

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.  It does not
change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description:
A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the
problem.
detail.example: The received '{}!@!.b}' email does not conform to the email format

instance.description:
A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the
problem.  It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

startDateTime.description: A reminder of the `startDateTime` used to produce this collection

startId.description: A reminder of the `startId` used to produce this collection

EmailAddress.description: A valid email address with a simplified format.

expectedOwnerType.description:
The kind of entity that will use the data validated by this new
validation code.

Invitation.description: An invitation to become administrator of an organisation

code.description:
The invitation code. A mix of 8 characters (upper or lower) or
digits.

createdAt.description: A timestamp of when this invitation has been created.

status.description:
The actual invitation state
  + `PENDING`        - waiting to be used by the guest
  + `LINKED`         - the guest is linked to an organisation
  +	`ALREADY_LINKED` - the guest has tried to link but was already in the organisation
  + `EXPIRED`        - the code is not valid anymore
  + `REVOKED`        - the invitation has been cancelled by an user

linkedAt.description:
A timestamp indicating when the guest has succesfully joined the
organisation via this invitation. Absent when not joined.

sendBy.description:
Choose the communication means used to send the invitation code:
 + `email` - one email with the instructions and code.
 + `sms`   - an email with the instructions but the code by SMS.
             The `phoneNumber` is required when this option is
             selected.

PhoneNumber.description:
Phone number at format e164 or hacked e164 where the leading "+"
character is replaced by "00".

Invitation_organisation.description: The organisation for which the invitation belongs to.

Invitation_professional.description:
A reference to the professional who has joined the organisation
via this invitation. Will be absent when `status` is different than
`LINKED`.

AccessTokenAuth.description: JWT access token passed as a cookie to authorize the request.
AccessTokenAuth.name: access-token

BearerAuth.description: JWT access token passed as bearer token to authorize the request.
